ai.summary: Stage 10 of the GM Ringway is a demanding 36.1 km section of the UK long-distance trail. The route features a mix of rural tracks, farm lanes, and occasional road crossings, with sustained ups and downs that test endurance and navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect mixed terrain: muddy fields and grassy paths, hedged lanes, forest edges, and several road sections. Surface quality varies and can become boggy after rain. The route includes gates and stiles and some longer gradual climbs.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before starting. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and layered clothing. Carry a map and compass or a reliable GPS device, plus extra food and water. Inform someone of your planned timings and route. Stay on marked paths and respect private property. Mobile signal can be patchy in rural areas. Exercise care on road sections and in poor visibility.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Extra layers and a lightweight blanket or bivy (optional)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September), though conditions can vary and rain is possible year-round.
